page.title: 01Ardingly and Surroundings
page.content: The area is composed of woodland and farmland, spread over high ground with deep valleys. Streams run allong the bottoms. the sides are too steep for farming. Farmland is mainly pasture with some arable. The village of Ardingly is on high ground, open on all sides. The older part is half a mile to the west of the main settlement around the Parish Church. Older buildings are of local sandstone, newer ones of brick. The 2000 inhabitants are mainly commuters working in business management, or domestic or maintenance staff at nearby Ardingly cottage. There are a small number of agricultural workers and shop staff in local services. The village is deminated by the reservoir to the west and by the south of England showground to the North. further Noth is the kew Gardens
